turns.text: Sir please help, main bahut dar gaya hoon. Ek bada neta type ka aadmi pe hamari family ne complaint diya hai, [Victim] minor hai. Log bol rahe hain ki yeh sab political hai, court isko serious nahi lega. Kya aise hi bol denge ki complaint fake hai? Bachchi ki baat pe vishwas karega koi? Samajh nahi aa raha kya hoga.

Mujhe samajh aa raha hai aap kitne tension mein hain, par aap akela nahin hain.

Law ke hisaab se, jab minor ke saath sexual offence ka allegation hota hai, toh POCSO Act lag sakta hai (jaise Section 7–10) aur IPC ke Sections jaise 354, 354A, 376, etc.

Court sirf “yeh political hai” bolne se complaint ignore nahi kar sakta. Magistrate ko evidence dekhna padta hai – complaint, [Victim] ka statement, audio recordings, medical/report, sab. Agar prima facie material hai, case proceed hoga.

Aap sach clearly bataate rahiye.

Humare paas kuch audio recording hai, jisme [Accused] ki awaaz lag rahi hai, vo [Victim] ko galat baate bol raha tha. Police ko de diya hai. Kya court mein yeh recording kaam aayegi? Ya bol denge editing hai, jhooth hai, political dushmani hai? Mujhe samajh nahi aa raha kitna weight hota hai aise proof ka.

Audio recording important evidence ban sakti hai, especially jab minor ka statement usse match karta ho.

Procedure yeh hota hai: police original recording le kar forensic / expert se check karwa sakti hai ki editing hai ya nahi. Court dekhta hai: kisne record kiya, kaise preserve kiya, chain of custody.

Charge decide karte waqt magistrate ko sirf yeh dekhna hota hai ki prima facie case banta hai ya nahi, final proof nahi. Agar audio aur statement saath‑saath accused par doubt dikhate hain, toh case aage badh sakta hai.

Sir ek aur baat, [Victim] ko baar baar police, court sab ke saamne bolna padega kya? Vo already bahut darr rahi hai, rona aata hai usko. Kya law mein aisa kuch hai ki bachchi ko kam se kam baar bolna pade, thoda safe feel kare? Hume process ka darr hai.

Aapka concern bilkul sahi hai, POCSO mein iske liye special protection hai.

Law ke mutabik:
- Police ko child‑friendly tareeke se statement lena chahiye, ghar ya safe jagah par (POCSO Section 24).
- Court mein case Special Court mein, in‑camera hota hai (POCSO Section 33), aam public allowed nahi hoti.
- Statement pehle hi CrPC Section 164 ke under magistrate ke saamne record ho sakta hai, taaki baar‑baar repeat na karna pade.

Aap Childline 1098 ya legal aid office se “support person” ke liye help maang sakte hain.

Log dara rahe hain ki agar court bole complaint jhoothi hai toh hum pe case ho jayega, jail ho sakte hain, kyunki vo neta powerful hai. Hum sach bol rahe hain lekin phir bhi darr lag raha hai. Kya aise cases mein complainant ko bhi punishment ho sakta hai agar judge ko lag gaya ki political motive tha?

Sirf isliye ki accused powerful ya political hai, complainant ko automatically punish nahi kiya jata.

IPC Section 182, 211 jhoothi complaint ke against hain, lekin yeh tab apply hote hain jab court ko clear proof mil jaaye ki jaan‑bujhkar jhooth bola gaya. Genuine victim/guardian, jo honest belief se complaint karta hai, generally punish nahi hota.

Aapka focus sirf sach batane par hona chahiye, jo [Victim] ne jhela hai woh clearly, bina exaggeration ke bataaye.

Agar aapko safety ka darr ho, to local police, legal aid, ya witness protection scheme ke baare mein pooch sakte hain.

Sir main bahut confuse hoon… net pe ek judgement padha tha jahan beti ne papa pe aisa case lagaya tha, baad me court ne papa ko chhod diya kyunki ladki ne baad me bol diya kuch nahi hua. Mere saath bhi papa ne bura kiya hai 2–3 saal se… main dar raha/rahi hoon kahin mera case bhi aisa na ho. Please batao kya kar sakta hoon?

Aap jo bata rahe hain woh bahut serious hai, aur aapka dar bilkul samajh aata hai. Father ya koi bhi adult agar child ke saath aise sexual acts kare, toh yeh POCSO Act Section 3 aur Section 5 (penetrative / aggravated sexual assault), ya Section 7 (sexual assault) ke under offence hai, saath me IPC Section 354 aur IPC Section 376 bhi lag sakte hain, facts par depend karta hai. Sabse pehle aapki safety zaroori hai: 1098 Childline, police, ya kisi trusted [Teacher]/[Relative] se help le sakte hain.

Par agar baad me court me family pressure aa gaya… sab bolen ghar ki izzat, case wapas le lo, warna main dabao me kuch aur bol doon… jaise us judgement me ladki ne badal diya tha bayan… to fir kya hoga? Mujhe punishment ho sakta hai kya agar main pehle complaint diya aur baad me dar ke chup ho gayi?

Court me jab witness apni baat badal deta hai to use "hostile" bolte hain, par law ye bhi maanta hai ki child pe family ka pressure ho sakta hai. Isliye important hai ki aap jitna ho sake sach bolen. Aapka statement magistrate ke saamne CrPC Section 164 ke under record ho sakta hai, aur POCSO Section 24 kehta hai ki child‑friendly tarike se statement lena chahiye. Focus aapki protection par hona chahiye, na ki aapko punish karne par. Aap counselor ya legal aid lawyer se bhi baat kar sakte hain.

Police ke paas main ek baar gaya/gayi tha, unhone likha bhi kuch, doctor ke paas bhi bheja tha. Ab relatives bol rahe hain complaint wapas le, warna sab kharab ho jayega. Kya police se bol sakta hoon ki kuch nahi hua tha? FIR wapas ho sakta hai kya? Ya phir mujhe chup rehna padega court me?

Child sexual abuse serious, non‑compoundable offence hota hai, normally aisi FIR simple tareeke se wapas nahi hoti. Agar aap dar ki wajah se court me bolte hain ki kuch nahi hua, to case weak ho sakta hai, lekin court ko yeh bhi dekhna chahiye ki kya aap pe pressure tha. IPC Section 354A jaise provisions harassment ko bhi cover karte hain. Sabse pehle apni safety sochiye: zaroorat ho to Juvenile Justice (JJ) Act ke under kisi child care home/shelter me rehne ka option hota hai. Legal aid lawyer se detail me samjhiye, akela decision mat lijiye.

Us judgement me to papa ko chhod diya tha, state ne shayad appeal bhi kiya tha par mujhe pura samajh nahi aaya. Agar mere case me bhi kal ko court se papa chhut gaya to phir kuch nahi ho sakta? Kya government fir se case chala sakti hai? Mera role us time kya hoga?

Agar trial court accuse ko acquit kar deta hai, to State government High Court me appeal file kar sakti hai, CrPC Section 378 ke under. Lekin appeal me standard strict hota hai, isliye result predict karna possible nahi. Aapka main role yahi rahega ki aap jo sach hai woh clearly batayein, aur proceedings me jab bulaaya jaye tab cooperate karein. Saath hi aap protection orders, counseling, aur rehne ke safe arrangements ke liye court, police, ya Child Welfare Committee se madad maang sakte hain.

Main abhi minor hoon, mummy bhi dar rahi hai, shayad support na kare. Mujhe step by step bata do, pehla kaam kya karun? Direct police station jaun, ya pehle 1098 pe call karun? Aur waha jaake exactly kya bolna hota hai, mujhe law ka zyada pata nahi hai.

Sabse pehle jahan aap relatively safe feel karte hain, waha se help maangiye. 1098 Childline par call karna achha option hai; woh police, shelter home, counselor sab se connect kara sakte hain. Aap seedha police station bhi ja sakte hain: bas simple shabdon me bata dijiye ki [Accused] ne aapke saath galat sexual cheez ki. POCSO Section 19 ke hisaab se koi bhi, including child, report kar sakta hai, aur police ko FIR register karni, medical aur protection arrange karna zaroori hai.

Main ek NGO volunteer hoon. Recently maine basti ke kuch bachchon ke saath photo li thi, parents ki permission ke bina. Ab ek local aadmi bol raha hai ki woh mere khilaaf child abuse ka case karega, POCSO aur Karnataka Epidemic Diseases Act ke under, bol raha hai ki maine “mental suffering” diya. Maine online Mohammed Harisnalapad wala High Court ka judgment dekha jahan sirf photo ke liye FIR quash hua. Kya mera case bhi waisa ho sakta hai?

Samajh sakta hoon, aisi situation bahut stressful lag sakti hai. Aap jis judgment ka zikr kar rahe hain, usme Karnataka High Court ne Section 75, Karnataka Epidemic Diseases Act ko isliye apply nahi maana kyunki accused ke paas bachchon ka “actual charge or control” nahi tha, sirf photo li gayi thi. POCSO ke liye sexual intent aur child sexual abuse ka clear element hona zaroori hota hai. Har case facts‑specific hota hai, isliye kisi local criminal lawyer se turant consult kijiye jo aapke facts ko detail me dekh sake.

Agar sirf normal group photo hai, koi touch ya sexual baat nahi hui, to kya phir bhi POCSO ya child sexual abuse law lag sakta hai? FIR register ho gaya to mujhe kya karna chahiye, practically steps kya honge?

General law ke hisaab se POCSO ke Sections 3–10 mainly sexual assault / aggravated assault cover karte hain, jisme sexual intent aur body contact ya sexual act dikhna chahiye. Sirf innocent group photo, bina sexual intent, usually POCSO ke scope me nahi aata. Lekin complainant phir bhi FIR ke liye ja sakta hai, police ko cognizable offence lage to register kar sakte hain. Practical steps: turant ek criminal lawyer se milke anticipatory bail ka option discuss kijiye, photo ka context ka evidence preserve kijiye, aur police me cooperative lekin lawyer ke through hi detailed statement dijiye.

Agar kal ko mere against FIR file ho jaye, kya main isi High Court judgment ka use karke FIR quash karwa sakta hoon? Process kya hota hai aur kya court is basis par mana kar sakti hai ki mere paas bachchon ka charge/control nahi tha?

Agar FIR Section 75 Karnataka Epidemic Diseases Act jaisa hi pattern follow kare, to yeh judgment aapke favour me strong precedent ban sakta hai, especially Karnataka me. Aapka lawyer High Court me Criminal Petition / Section 482 CrPC ke under quashing petition file karega, yeh dikha kar ki: (1) aapke paas bachchon ka “actual charge or control” nahi tha, (2) koi sexual intent ya POCSO ingredients nahi hain. Court har case alag facts pe dekhegi, isliye result guarantee nahi hota, par yeh judgment zaroor persuasive support de sakta hai.

statutes_cited: Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act, Sections 3–10, 19, 24

turns.text: Main ek NGO ke through kaam kar raha hoon. Ek case me [Victim], jo minor hai, ne statement diya ki teen alag-alag [Accused] ne alag dates par uske saath penetrative sexual acts kiye aur baad me paise diye. Yeh sab usne court me PW ke roop me bhi repeat kiya hai. Is situation me POCSO Section 19 ke under mere liye mandatory reporting ka obligation kya hoga agar mujhe yeh baat counselling ke dauran pata chale?

Jo facts aap describe kar rahe hain, woh clearly penetrative sexual assault ke category me aate hain, toh POCSO Section 19 ke hisaab se mandatory reporting lagti hai. Koi bhi person, including NGO worker / counsellor, yeh information police ya Special Juvenile Police Unit ko dena legally required hai. Aap written complaint dekar FIR register karwa sakte hain, aur Childline 1098 ko bhi inform kar sakte hain. Saath hi, [Victim] ki safety, medical care aur counselling turant arrange karna bahut zaroori hai.

Thik hai. Abhi police ne FIR register kar li hai under POCSO Sections for penetrative sexual assault, lekin 161 CrPC statement ke time police ne kaafi leading questions puche aur child visibly dar gaya. POCSO Section 24 me child-friendly procedure ka mention hai. Is situation me hum kya steps le sakte hain taaki 164 CrPC statement properly, bina intimidation ke, record ho?

Aap written application dekar IO ko request kar sakte hain ki jaldi se jaldi 164 CrPC statement magistrate ke saamne record ho. Aap yeh bhi likh sakte hain ki 161 statement child-friendly manner me nahi hua tha, isliye fresh, detailed statement zaroori hai. Magistrate ke saamne statement in-camera, bina uniform, preferably woman magistrate aur woman police officer ke saath ho sakta hai. POCSO Section 24, 26 aur Section 39 ke spirit me support person/counsellor ka request bhi kar sakte hain.

Trial stage ke context me ek doubt hai: is case me PW2, yani [Victim], ne court me clear narration diya tha ki har [Accused] ne alag occasion par uske saath penetrative act kiya. Cross-examination me defence ne in specific acts ko detail me challenge nahi kiya, sirf general suggestion diya ki woh jhooth bol rahi hai. Evidence law ke hisaab se aisi unchallenged specific testimony ka kya evidentiary value hota hai?

Generally practice yeh hai ki agar cross-examination me kisi witness ke crucial, specific facts ko properly confront nahi kiya jata, toh court un points ko unchallenged maan sakta hai aur unko kaafi weight deta hai. CSA/POCSO matters me consistent, natural child testimony ko kaafi importance milti hai, chahe independent corroboration kam ho. Lekin final finding judge saare evidence, medical, circumstances, contradictions sab ko dekh kar karega. Aapka role hai ki child ko support mile aur woh bina fear ke sach bol sake.

Under POCSO aur allied laws, [Victim] ke liye compensation aur long-term rehabilitation ke kya options hain? Kya hum POCSO court se compensation application file karein ya directly DLSA ke paas Victim Compensation Scheme ke under jayen? Practically, kaunsi authority ko approach karna zyada effective hota hai, especially jab conviction abhi pending hai?

Do parallel routes hain. POCSO court ke paas power hai ki Section 33(8) POCSO read with CrPC Section 357A ke under interim aur final compensation order kare, chahe conviction ho ya na ho. Saath hi, aap District Legal Services Authority (DLSA) ko direct application de sakte hain State Victim Compensation Scheme ke tahat. Dono jagah medical, counselling, education, shelter ka detail mention karein. Practically, DLSA ko early intimation dena helpful hota hai, taaki interim relief jaldi process ho.

Main ek NGO ke through POCSO cases track karta hoon. Recent High Court bail order me, jahan [Accused] October se custody me tha, court ne is basis par bail di ki FIR me uske khilaf direct allegation ya naam se specific role nahi tha, aur prosecutrix ke statements bhi supportive the. Aap explain kar sakte hain ki aise situation me Section 19 POCSO ki mandatory reporting duty, FIR ki evidentiary value, aur CrPC 164 statement ko court bail stage par kaise weigh karta hoga?

Is type ke bail order me court generally yeh dekhta hai ki FIR aur Section 161/164 CrPC statements me [Accused] ke khilaf specific role hai ya nahi. POCSO cases non‑bailable hain, lekin agar FIR me direct allegation nahi, prosecutrix ka statement supportive ho, aur [Accused] ka clean antecedent ho, to court discretionary power under CrPC Section 439 use karke bail de sakta hai. Section 19 POCSO ki mandatory reporting duty FIR ka validity decide nahi karti, sirf reporting ensure karti hai.

Is case jaisa scenario ho, jahan bail mil gaya par trial pending hai, to victim‑protection ke liye court kin typical conditions ko impose kar sakta hai? Khas kar POCSO context me: no‑contact condition, same locality me entry ban, school ya tuition vicinity se door rehna, witness‑tampering prohibition, etc. Kya NGO ke roop me hum written submissions ke through court ya prosecution ko suggest kar sakte hain ki aise safeguards bail order me specifically include kiye jayen?

High Court jab bail grant karta hai, especially POCSO matter me, to usually kuch strict conditions lagata hai, jaise: (1) [Accused] directly ya indirectly [Victim] se contact nahi karega; (2) same locality me unnecessarily present nahi hoga; (3) evidence tamper nahi karega; (4) regular court me present hoga. Aap NGO worker ke roop me police aur prosecution ko written representation de sakte hain ki bail conditions me no‑contact, school/tuition approach ban, aur periodic local SHO monitoring jaise safeguards add kiye jayen.

Mujhe ek case samajhna hai. Ek 15 saal ki [Victim] ke khilaf uske hi father [Accused] ne ghar par baar‑baar sexual abuse kiya. Baad me mother ke through complaint di gayi, thoda delay bhi hua. Mainly sirf victim aur mother ka statement hai. Is type case me POCSO apply hota hai na? Aur kya itne evidence par court conviction de sakta hai, jaise Kerala wale case me hua tha?

Is situation me POCSO bilkul apply hota hai. Jab father jaisa guardian sexual assault karta hai, yeh generally POCSO Section 9(n) (aggravated sexual assault) r/w Section 10 ke under aata hai. Court aksar मानता hai ki child ke clear, consistent statement ko high value diya ja sakta hai, chahe independent witness kam ho. Delay in complaint family CSA cases me common hai, isse case automatic weak nahi ho jata. Aapke liye zaroori hai ki [Victim] ki safety aur support pe focus ho.

Agar defence yeh bole ki koi medical report nahi, koi independent witness nahi, sirf victim ka bayan hai, toh kya sirf us basis par bhi conviction possible hai? Aur agar trial court ne conviction de diya ho, toh appeal me kaise dekhenge, jaise is Kerala case me father ne challenge kiya tha?

Child sexual abuse cases me courts ne baar‑baar kaha hai ki agar victim ka statement natural, consistent aur cross‑examination me stable ho, toh sirf us par bhi conviction possible hai. POCSO Section 29–30 me presumption of guilt / culpable mental state ka provision hai, jo accused ke against jata hai jab basic facts prove ho jayein. Medical absence ya independent witness na hona fatal nahi hota. Appeal me High Court evidence dubara assess karta hai, par generally reasonable conviction ko easily reverse nahi karta.

Agar kisi ko apne ghar me aisa ho raha ho aur father hi accused ho, toh practically kya steps lene chahiye? FIR kahan karein, child ko kaise safe rakhen, aur kya koi special procedure hai child ke statement ke liye?

Sabse pehle safety: agar turant danger ho toh nearest police station ya 112 call karein, ya Childline 1098 par call kar sakte hain. POCSO Section 19 ke hisaab se koi bhi person police ko information de sakta hai; FIR register karni hoti hai. Child ka statement child‑friendly tareeke se record hona chahiye, POCSO Section 24 ke under. Zarurat pade toh Child Welfare Committee ke through shelter home arrange ho sakta hai, JJ Act ke under. Local lawyer ya trusted NGO se legal aur emotional support lena bhi helpful hoga.

Meri relative [Accused] 65 saal ki domestic helper hai. Us par allegation hai ki jab woh akeli thi 1.5 saal ki [Victim] ke saath, bachchi ko injury ho gayi, aur mother ne child safety law ke under complaint de di. FIR mein POCSO laga hai, Sessions Court ne do baar bail reject kar di hai. Is situation mein kya High Court se bail mil sakti hai? Judge kin points ko dekhte hain aise matter mein?

Aisi allegation bohot sensitive hoti hai, isliye aapka tension understandable hai. POCSO ke cases serious hote hain, lekin bail legally possible hai, specially jab [Accused] ki age zyada ho aur direct evidence kam ho. High Court CrPC Section 439 ke under dekhta hai: 
- kya direct testimony ya sirf suspicion hai
- medical report kya bolti hai
- [Accused] ka past record
- flight risk, witness ko influence ka risk
Aapko ek experienced criminal/POCSO lawyer ke through detailed bail petition file karni chahiye.

Yahan pe direct eyewitness koi nahi hai, sirf mother ka suspicion hai ki injury us time hui jab [Accused] akeli thi. Medical report mein serious sexual injury mention nahi hai, sirf minor injury likha hai. Aise case mein bhi POCSO ke serious Section lag sakte hain? Court evidence ko kaise evaluate karta hai bail ke time, specially jab bachchi itni chhoti ho?

POCSO Act ke Section 3–10 different types of sexual assault define karte hain, isliye police kabhi‑kabhi precaution se serious Section laga dete hain. Bail stage par Court:
- medical report carefully padhta hai
- mother ka statement
- jo bhi available medical/circumstantial evidence ho
Chhoti age ki wajah se [Victim] ka statement usually Section 24 POCSO ke hisaab se child‑friendly manner mein liya jata hai. Direct eyewitness na hona bail ke favour mein point ho sakta hai, lekin Court ko overall circumstances dekhkar hi decision lena hota hai.

Abhi Sessions Court ne do baar bail reject kar di. High Court mein bail file karne ka exact process kya hoga? Kya 65+ age ek strong ground ban sakta hai? Aur agar bail milti hai to normally kaunsi conditions lagti hain, jaise [Accused] ko [Victim] ke ghar ke paas na jana, ya regularly court mein present rehna, etc.?

Process yeh hoga: aapke lawyer ko High Court mein CrPC Section 439 ke under bail petition file karni hogi, saath mein:
- Sessions Court ke rejection orders
- medical papers
- [Accused] ki age proof, medical issues, clean record
Age, health aur direct evidence ka weak hona bail ke favour mein factors ban sakte hain. Conditions usually:
- [Victim]/family se contact nahi rakhna
- unke ghar/area ke paas nahi jana
- har tarikh par court mein present rehna
- witness ko influence na karna. Violation par bail cancel ho sakti hai.

Mujhe bachchi ke liye bhi concern hai, agar sach mein kuch hua ho. Uske protection aur counselling ke liye law kya help deta hai? Family kin authorities ya helplines se contact kar sakti hai, taaki bachchi ko safe environment aur psychological support mile, chahe case chal raha ho ya nahi?

Bachchi ki safety sabse important hai. Family:
- turant Childline 1098 par call kar sakti hai
- local Child Welfare Committee / District Child Protection Unit se contact kar sakti hai
POCSO Section 19 ke under report karna mandatory hota hai; police Special Juvenile Police Unit ke through case handle karti hai. Statement child‑friendly manner mein record hona chahiye (Section 24). Juvenile Justice Act ke under CWC counselling, shelter, “support person” arrange kar sakta hai. Free legal aid bhi District Legal Services Authority se mil sakti hai.

Sir please help, maine online ek Madras High Court ka order dekha tha jahan ek lady pe bachche ko maarne, torture karne ka case tha, baad me court ne bola ki proof nahi hai, case khatam. Mujhe darr lag raha hai, mere sasural wale bhi mujhpe ya mere bachche pe aise hi jhoote child abuse wale case daal denge to? Samajh nahi aa raha kya hoga mere saath.

Aapka darr bilkul genuine hai, main samajh sakta hoon. Jo judgement aapne dekhi, waha court ne evidence na hone par case quash kiya, har case facts pe depend karta hai. Agar koi aap par child sexual abuse ka jhootha case lagata hai, to court POCSO Act (Sections 3–7) ke definition, statements, medical report, mobile chats sab dekhega. Isliye jitna ho sake sachcha record, messages, neighbours ke contact details safe rakhiye, aur kisi lawyer se personally advice zaroor lijiye.

Agar real me kisi [Relative] ne mere [Minor] ke saath galat cheez ki ho, par family bolti hai chup raho, badnaam ho jaoge, to fir main kya karu? Police ka naam sunke bhi dar lagta hai, bachcha bhi shock me hai. Complaint ka process simple words me bata do please, mujhe law ka kuch idea nahi hai.

Agar [Minor] ke saath sexual abuse hua hai, to silence rakhna zaroori nahi, protection zaroori hai. Aap yeh steps soch sakte hain: 1) Nearest police station me jaake FIR karna; yeh POCSO Sections 3–10 ke under aata hai, saath me IPC 354, 354A, 376 bhi lag sakte hain. 2) Childline 1098 par call kijiye, woh police, Child Welfare Committee connect kara sakte hain. 3) POCSO Section 19 reporting encourage karta hai, Section 24 child‑friendly statement ke bare me hai.

Agar police hi serious na le, bole family matter hai, ya complaint likhne se mana kar de to? Main gareeb hoon, private lawyer afford nahi kar sakti, aur mujhe English bhi zyada nahi aati. Aise me bachche ka case kaise aage badhega, kya koi aur jagah hai complain karne ki?

Agar local police FIR register na kare, aap: 1) Written complaint SP/Commissioner ko speed post ya email se bhej sakte hain. 2) Court me application dekar judge se request kar sakte hain ki FIR register ho (CrPC Section 156(3)). 3) District Legal Services Authority se free legal aid lawyer mil sakta hai. Childline 1098 se bhi guidance milegi. Juvenile Justice Act ke through Child Welfare Committee bachche ko protection, counselling aur care ke orders de sakti hai.

Agar main complaint kar do to [Accused] badla le sakta hai, ghar aa ke dhamki de, ya mere upar jhoothe cases daal de jaise maine judgement me dekha tha. Kya mujhe aur [Minor] ko koi legal protection mil sakta hai? Aur kya case bahut saal chalega, bachcha aur disturb ho jayega?

Aapki safety sabse important hai. Aap police se written complaint me hi mention kijiye ki [Accused] se jaan ka ya harassment ka darr hai, police protection ya restraining type conditions maang sakte hain. POCSO cases special court me chalte hain, waha child‑friendly procedure hota hai, repeat questioning kam se kam ho, Section 24 isi liye hai. Judge bail dete waqt strict conditions rakh sakte hain. Zarurat pade to Protection Officer, women’s helpline, shelter home ka support bhi mil sakta hai.

Madam ji please help, mera bhatija 16 saal ka hai, uspe chhote bacche ke saath gandi harkat ka case laga diya, police ne usko pakad ke andar kar diya. Judge ne usko bail bhi nahi di. Pehle kabhi koi case nahi tha. Main bohot darr gaya hoon, kya minor ke liye alag rule nahi hota? Samajh nahi aa raha kya karein.

Mujhe samajh aa raha hai aap bohot tense hain, aapka darr valid hai. Haan, minors ke liye alag law hota hai, Juvenile Justice Act. Isme ek important provision hai, Section 12, jisme general rule yeh hai ki child ko bail milni chahiye, jab tak court ko lage ki: (1) woh kisi dangerous aadmi ke contact mein aa sakta hai, (2) dobara offence kar sakta hai, ya (3) uski safety khatre mein hai. Court usually Probation Officer ka social investigation report dekh kar decision leti hai.

Judge ne bola ki agar bahar aayega toh buri sangat ka risk hai isliye mana kiya. Lekin hum log seedhe-saadhe hain, ghar ka mahol theek hai. Kya hum proof dikha sakte hain ki ghar safe hai? Kaun kaun se paper dene chahiye? Aur yeh probation officer kaun hota hai, usse kaise baat karein?

Court ko lagta hai ki child bahar aakar wrong company mein na chala jaye, isliye woh risk check karti hai. Probation Officer sarkari officer hota hai jo child aur family ka social investigation report banata hai. Aap lawyer ke through court ko application de sakte hain: school records, good behaviour certificates, family ke ID, ghar ke zimmedar logon ke affidavit, counselling ka proof, yeh sab attach karke. Lawyer request kar sakta hai ki fresh/updated social investigation report banai jaye aur uske basis par bail dubara consider ho.

Ek baat aur, humko lagta hai ilzam jhooth hai, ladki ke parents ne gusse mein case kar diya. Agar aisa hai toh FIR ka kya hoga? POCSO case bol rahe hain sab. Kya aise case easily band ho sakta hai? Dar lagta hai bachche ke future pe criminal record lag jayega.

POCSO ke cases (jaise sexual assault, jo generally Sections 3–10 ke under aate hain) bohot serious mante hain, isliye FIR aasani se withdraw nahi hoti. Police investigation karegi, statements record hongi, medical/other evidence dekha jayega. Agar evidence weak ya jhootha lage toh police closure report de sakti hai ya court se acquittal mil sakta hai, lekin guarantee nahi hoti. Juvenile ka naam generally publish nahi hota, aur JJ Act ke under uska long‑term record protect kiya jata hai. Aapko ek experienced POCSO/JJ lawyer zaroor lena chahiye.

Abhi turant hum kya kar sakte hain? Bail ke liye kahan apply karein, humara shehar chhota hai, police se bhi thoda dar lagta hai. Aur agar asli victim bachcha ho toh uski safety ke liye bhi kya help mil sakti hai? Koi helpline number wagairah hai kya?

Practical steps: (1) Local criminal lawyer jo POCSO aur Juvenile Justice matters handle karta ho, usse milke bail ka appeal ya revision higher court (Sessions/High Court) mein file karwa sakte hain, JJ Act Section 12 ka reference dekar. (2) Probation Officer se respectfully milkar sahi family facts bata sakte hain. (3) Free legal aid ke liye District Legal Services Authority se contact kar sakte hain. Agar koi child victim hai, uske protection ke liye police ko inform karna aur Childline 1098 par call karna ek safe option hai; POCSO Section 19 reporting aur Section 24 child‑friendly statement provide karta hai.

Sir please help… mera beta [Victim] chhota hai. Usne bola tha ki [Accused] ne usko galat tareeke se touch kiya jab woh maa ke ghar rehta tha. Ab police ne FIR, charge-sheet sab bana diya, Child Welfare Committee ne bhi kuch report likhi hai. Mujhe bilkul samajh nahi aa raha kya ho raha hai, court, case, sab se dar lag raha hai. Main bas chahta hoon mera bachcha safe rahe. Ab next kya hoga?

Aapka dar bilkul samajh mein aata hai, aapne bahaduri se bachche ki baat sunkar action liya. Ab jo ho raha hai woh normal legal process hai. FIR ke baad police investigation karti hai, phir charge-sheet court mein file hoti hai. Child Welfare Committee (CWC) JJ Act ke under bachche ki safety aur welfare dekhti hai. Is type ke matter generally POCSO Act ke under aate hain. Aapko ek lawyer aur counsellor ki madad leni chahiye, taaki aapko har step simple language mein samjhaya ja sake.

Ji… CWC mein mere bete ne bola tha ki [Accused] ne usko galat jagah touch kiya tha. Ab mujhe darr hai [Accused] ko jail ho jayegi? Kaunse law lagte hain aise case mein? Kya mera bachcha ko court mein sabke saamne bolna padega? Woh already bahut dar gaya hai, main nahi chahta usko aur trauma ho. Please thoda clear batao.

Jo aap bata rahe hain woh “sexual abuse/galat touch” category mein aa sakta hai, jo generally POCSO Act ke Section 3 ya 7 type offences ke under aata hai, saath mein IPC Section 354, 354A bhi lag sakte hain. Punishment court decide karegi, main result guarantee nahi kar sakta. Bachche ke liye special protection hoti hai: POCSO Section 24 ke hisaab se child‑friendly procedure, in‑camera hearing, video‑conferencing, counsellor, support person use ho sakte hain, taaki usko minimum stress ho. Aap lawyer aur prosecutor se yeh safeguards ke baare mein clearly pooch sakte hain.

Abhi sabse zyada tension yeh hai ki mera bachcha safe rahe. [Accused] ki family pressure daal rahi hai ki complaint wapas le lo, compromise kar lo. Woh log bol rahe hain FIR quash ho sakta hai agar main sign kar doon. Mujhe samajh nahi aa raha kya sahi hai, kahin main galat paper pe sign na kar doon. Main abhi turant kya steps loon?

Turant kisi independent lawyer ya District Legal Services Authority se free legal aid lijiye. Agar threat/pressure ho raha hai to local police ko likhit complaint dijiye. Bachche ka [Accused] se akela contact bilkul na hone dein. Zaroorat ho to Childline 1098 par call kar sakte hain.

turns.text: Sir please help… mere bachchi ke saath [Accused] ne galat kaam kiya tha, usko dawa jaisa kuch pilaya tha. Case court me gaya, lekin ab judge ne bola sexual assault proof nahi hua, sirf chhota sa offence maana. Mujhe samajh nahi aa raha, kya ab kuch nahi ho sakta? Mujhe samajh aa raha hai aap kitna pain feel kar rahe hain, yeh situation bahut heavy hoti hai.

Court ne shayad yeh bola hoga ki sexual assault wale charges (jaise POCSO Section 3–4 ya 7–8, IPC Section 376) "beyond reasonable doubt" prove nahi hue, isliye woh set aside kiye. Lekin iske against aap higher court me appeal file kar sakte hain. Aap kisi experienced criminal/POCSO lawyer se milke judgment ka copy lekar discuss karein ki appeal possible hai ya nahi.

Par sir, judge ne bola statements clear nahi hain, mother aur doctor ki baat match nahi ho rahi. Kya fir se case shuru ho sakta hai? Ya phir hum log koi naya evidence de sakte hain? Important evidence ho sakta hai:
- [Victim] ka statement (POCSO Section 24 ke hisaab se child‑friendly tareeke se liya gaya ho)
- Medical records, hospital papers
- Aapka, doctor ka, aur dusre witnesses ka testimony

Aapko ek lawyer ke saath judgment line‑by‑line dekhkar grounds of appeal prepare karne chahiye.

Aapki safety aur bachchi ki safety sabse important hai.

- District SP/CP ko written complaint de sakte hain
- Court me application (jaise CrPC Section 156(3)) ke through better investigation ki request kar sakte hain, lawyer ke through

Bachchi ki protection ke liye:
- Childline 1098 par call kar sakte hain
- Local Child Welfare Committee ya District Legal Services Authority se help le sakte hain

Agar sexual wala part court ne nahi maana, to kya hamari bachchi ko koi compensation bhi nahi milega? Itna trauma hua hai, school bhi chhod diya tha kuch time. Paisa sab problem solve nahi karta, par treatment, counselling ka kharcha kaise chalega? Koi sarkari madad mil sakti hai kya abhi bhi?

POCSO ke under, Special Court ko power hota hai ki woh interim aur final compensation order kare (jaise Section 33(8), related Rules). Aap:
- Apne lawyer se keh sakte hain ki court me compensation application file kare

Ek last sawal… mujhe dar hai kahin log social media pe meri bachchi ka naam, photo na daal dein. Kuch log already gandi baatein kar rahe hain. Kya law me aisa kuch hai jo bacchon ka naam chupane ke liye protection deta ho? Agar koi naam daal de to main kya kar sakti hoon?

- Agar kisi ne social media par aisa kiya, aap screenshot lekar turant police me complaint kar sakte hain.

Sir please help, main bahut darr me hoon. Meri 4 saal ki beti [Victim] ko hamare gaon ka aadmi [Accused] raat ko le gaya tha, bachi ke saath galat kaam kiya. Aapka dukh samajh sakta hoon, aapne bahut himmat dikhayi hai case chala kar. Aise matter me law bahut strict hai. Agar aisa situation aaye, aap lawyer se request kar sakte hain ki bachchi ko protect kiya jaye.

Sir ek aur baat, hum gareeb log hain. Treatment, counselling, school sab ka kharcha ho raha hai. Kya isme government se koi madad, compensation mil sakta hai? Police ne is bare me kuch clear nahi bataya, bas bola court dekh lega. Mujhe process hi samajh nahi aa raha, kahan apply karein?

Aapko do tarah se madad mil sakti hai. POCSO ke andar court ko power hai ki victim ko compensation de (jaise Section 33(8)). Saath hi har state me Victim Compensation Scheme hoti hai, CrPC Section 357A ke through, jo District Legal Services Authority (DLSA) handle karti hai. Aap free me DLSA office ya legal aid lawyer ke through application de sakte hain. Childline 1098 par call karke bhi guidance le sakte hain.

Maine complaint thoda late kiya tha, pehle sharam aur darr lag raha tha, gaon wale bhi rok rahe the. 1–2 din baad hi police ke paas gaye. Ab saamne wale keh rahe hain ki delay hai isliye case weak ho jayega, court nahi manega. Kya sach me sirf is wajah se case kharab ho sakta hai?

Child sexual abuse cases me delay common hai, kyunki family shock, darr, social pressure me hoti hai. POCSO Section 19 duty to report batata hai, par aapne report kar di, yeh important hai. Aapke lawyer ko yeh sab court me explain karna hoga, aap is point se akeli nahi hain.

Media wale puchne aaye the, naam aur photo mang rahe the. Gaon me log gossip kar rahe hain, mujhe dar hai kahin mere bachchi ka naam kahin chhap na jaye, uska future kharab ho jayega. Kya law me aisa koi rule hai jo bachchi ka naam, pahchan chhupane ka bolta ho?

Bilkul, law aapki beti ki identity ko protect karta hai. POCSO Section 23 aur IPC Section 228A ke hisaab se media ya koi bhi person victim ka naam, photo, address, school ka naam, kuch bhi jo pahchan bata de, publish ya broadcast nahi kar sakta. Agar koi aisa kare, to woh khud offence karega. Aap police ko written complaint de sakte hain, ya legal aid lawyer se turant help maang sakte hain.

Agar kal ko woh aadmi bail pe bahar aa gaya, ya uske log zyada dhamki dene lage to main kya kar sakti hoon? Abhi se bol rahe hain case wapas lo warna accha nahi hoga. Main apni beti ke safety ke liye bahut tension me hoon, ghar se bahar nikalne me bhi darr lagta hai.

Agar dhamki mil rahi hai to turant nearest police station me written complaint dijiye, mention kariye ki yeh POCSO case ka pressure hai. Court se bail cancel karne ya stricter condition lagwane ki request ki ja sakti hai. Aap protection ke liye application de sakte hain. Zarurat ho to JJ Act ke under shelter home / counselling bhi mil sakti hai. Childline 1098, DLSA aur local women/child helplines se support lena bilkul theek hai.

Mere paas ek case summary aaya hai jahan ek 35 saal ka aadmi pe allegation hai ki usne ek minor girl ke saath sexual act kiya. Defence bol raha hai ki [Victim] ne chillaya nahi, resist nahi kiya, aur medical opinion me bhi serious injury nahi dikhi. Kya aise situation me POCSO apply hota hai? Aise cases me sabse pehle yeh clear karna zaroori hai ki agar [Victim] 18 se kam hai, to POCSO definitely apply hoga. POCSO me consent ya protest na karna legally relevant nahi mana jata, kyunki child ki “consent” ko law valid nahi maanta. 

Medical injury na hona bhi automatic tareeke se case ko weak nahi banata. Court usually [Victim] ka statement, circumstances, aur medical + other evidence sab mila‑kar dekhta hai, phir decision leta hai.

Samajh gaya. Lekin defence jo argument de raha hai ki ladki ne resist nahi kiya, chillaya bhi nahi, is basis pe High Court me criminal petition file kar diya gaya hai. Kya aise argument se bail mil sakti hai ya case quash ho sakta hai? Law generally is point ko kaise dekhta hai, especially POCSO ke under?

POCSO ke under, yeh argument kaafi weak mana jata hai. Child sexual abuse me bahut baar bachche shock, dar, ya threat ki wajah se chillate nahi, resist bhi kam karte hain. Court bail decide karte waqt mainly yeh dekhta hai: 

- [Victim] ka statement (especially 164 CrPC statement)
- Prima facie evidence
- Offence ki seriousness (POCSO Sections 3–10, IPC 376/354, etc.)

Sirf itna ki bachchi ne chillaya nahi, is ground par generally na case quash hota hai, na automatic bail milti hai; overall facts dekhe jaate hain.

Thik hai. Investigation stage me jab police [Victim] ka statement leti hai, to child-friendly process ke kya safeguards hote hain? Family ko darr hai ki police ya lawyers se bachchi ko aur trauma ho jayega. Kya POCSO me specifically kuch protection diya gaya hai statement record karne ke time?

Haan, POCSO me child-friendly procedure mandatory hai. Kuch important safeguards:

- Section 24 POCSO: child ka statement, possible ho to female police officer, familiar environment me, school/ghar ke aas-paas, thana ke formal setting me nahi.
- Repeated questioning avoid ki jati hai.
- 164 CrPC statement Magistrate ke saamne, closed, safe environment me.
- Special Court in-camera trial karta hai, public ko bahar rakhta hai.

Agar aapko lagta hai procedure follow nahi ho raha, aap lawyer ya Special Court ko turant bata sakte hain.

Agar [Victim] ki family pe village level par pressure aa raha ho compromise karne ka, ya FIR wapas lene ka, to legally unko kya steps lene chahiye? Koi compromise possible hai kya, ya yeh offences non-compoundable hote hain? Safety ke liye practical steps bata dijiye.

Child sexual abuse cases (POCSO + IPC 376/354 type offences) generally non‑compoundable hote hain, matlab formal compromise se case khatam nahi hota. Pressure aane par aap log yeh steps soch sakte hain:

- Kisi bhi blank paper par sign na karein.
- Local SP ya higher police officer ko written complaint de sakte hain ki pressure dala ja raha hai.
- Childline 1098, District Legal Services Authority, ya trusted NGO se support le sakte hain.
- Court me application de kar protection ya no-contact condition request ki ja sakti hai.

Sir please help, main bahut darr gayi hoon. Meri beti [Victim] 15 saal ki hai, usko ek girls home me rakh diya hai. Bol rahe hain 18 saal tak wahin rahegi. Main samajh sakta hoon aapko kitna tension ho raha hoga. Aise cases me aksar Child Welfare Committee (CWC) order deti hai, especially agar bachche ke saath sexual abuse ka doubt ho, jo POCSO Act ke under aata hai.

Aapke case me lagta hai CWC ne protection ke liye order diya hai, isliye “illegal custody” nahi, protective custody mana jaata hai.

Aap yeh steps le sakti hain:
1) CWC office se likhit order copy maangna.
2) Legal Aid Authority se free lawyer lena.
3) Court ya CWC me application dekar milne ka right aur status clear karwana.

Unhone bola ki mere husband ne hi galat kaam kiya tha, isliye case bana hai. Usko police le gayi thi. Par mujhe detail nahi samajh aayi, sirf itna pata hai koi child law laga hai. Agar father ne abuse kiya hai, to usually POCSO ke serious Sections lagte hain, jaise Section 5(l), 5(n), 6, aur kabhi‑kabhi IPC Section 376 bhi. Yeh offences non‑bailable aur kaafi serious hote hain.

Aapko:
1) Police ke saamne sach sach batana hai, koi compromise ya pressure me aakar statement change nahi karna.
2) Statement dete waqt aap lawyer ya Legal Aid ka vakil maang sakti hain.
3) Agar kisi ne zabardasti sign karwaya ho, aap turant likhit complaint de sakti hain.

Agar main chaahun ki beti wapas mere saath ghar pe rahe, toh uske liye kya process hai? Kya main turant court jaake bola ki home se release karo? Ya pehle committee ke paas jana padega? Normally pehla step CWC hi hota hai, kyunki unhone hi order diya hoga.

1) CWC ko written application dijiye “restoration of child to mother” ke liye, JJ Act ke under.
2) Apni situation explain karein: safe ghar, income, support system.
3) Woh log home study/report aur counselling kara sakte hain.
4) Jab tak final decide na ho, aap supervised meetings ka request kar sakti hain.
5) Agar CWC ka order unfair lage, aap lawyer ke through higher court me appeal/habeas corpus file karne ka option rakh sakti hain.

Sir please help.. meri chhoti beti ka case chal raha hai, uske saath bura hua tha. Abhi judge ne suna hai us aadmi ko jail se chhod diya, bol rahe bail mil gaya. Main bahut dar gayi hoon. Kya iska matlab case khatam ho gaya? woh bach jayega kya?

Aapka dar bilkul sahi hai, lekin clear kar du: bail ka matlab yeh nahi ki case khatam ho gaya ya woh free ho gaya. Bail sirf itna hai ki trial ke time woh jail ke bahar rahega, lekin POCSO aur IPC ke under jo charges hain, case court mein continue rahega. Court normally bail ke saath conditions lagata hai, jaise victim se contact na karna. Agar woh rule तोड़े, bail cancel ho sakti hai.

Par woh hamare gaon ka hi hai, ghar ke paas se guzarta hai. Mujhe darr hai ki woh hamko dhamkaye ya samjhauta bol de. Aise time mein police sunegi kya? Kya bolna ya likhna padega agar woh kuch galat kare?

Agar woh aapko ya [Victim] ko dhamkaye, follow kare, ya pressure daale, turant nearest police station ya 112 par call karein. Dhamki dena khud ek offence hai, generally IPC Section 506 ke under aata hai. Aap written complaint de sakte hain, mention karein ki POCSO case mein accused ne bail condition तोड़ी. Aap investigation officer ko bhi inform karein. Court mein bail cancel application bhi file ho sakta hai, lawyer ke through.

Meri beti pregnant ho gayi thi us baat se… hospital le gaye the, log bahut baatein kar rahe hain. Kya hospital wale ya police sabko bata denge? Uski izzat ka kya hoga? Woh already bahut dar rahi hai, rona aata hai use.

Law ke hisaab se [Victim] ki identity protect karna zaroori hai. POCSO Act aur court rules ke according uska naam, photo public nahi kiya ja sakta. Court mein in-camera trial hota hai, public ko andar allow nahi karte. POCSO Section 24 type provisions ke through child-friendly procedure hota hai. Aap counselling ke liye district hospital, one-stop centre, ya Childline 1098 se help maang sakte hain, unka kaam support aur confidentiality maintain karna hai.
Police ne pehle bhi uska bayan likha tha, phir court mein bhi bulaya tha. Kya use baar baar sab bolna padega? Woh court se bahut ghabraati hai, kehti hai main muh nahi khol paungi.

Normally process mein ek baar police ke saamne statement, phir magistrate ke saamne detailed statement, aur trial ke time evidence hota hai. POCSO mein judge ko child-friendly tarike se poochna chahiye, Section 33, 36 jaisi provisions bacha ko protect karte hain. Kabhi-kabhi screen laga kar ya video-conferencing se bhi child ka evidence liya jata hai. Aap court se support person, counsellor ya special educator ki request kar sakte hain, jo uske saath rahe.
Ghar wale bol rahe hain chhodo case, samjhauta kar lo, warna lamba chalta rahega. Kya main case wapas le sakti hoon? Agar main kuch na bolun to kya case band ho jayega?

Is type ka matter, jisme sexual assault aur POCSO offences lage hain, generally non-compoundable hote hain, matlab compromise se case simple tarah se band nahi hota. State (sarkar) prosecution chalati hai, sirf family decide nahi kar sakti ki case khatam ho. Agar aap dar ki wajah se chup rahenge, toh case weak ho sakta hai, isliye protection, counselling aur legal support lena bahut zaroori hai. Decision soch samajh kar lijiye.
Mere paas paise nahi hain achha lawyer rakhne ke. Sarkari taraf se koi free lawyer mil sakta hai kya? Kahan jaaun, kis se milun, mujhe process hi samajh nahi aa raha.

Aapko free legal aid ka right hai. District Legal Services Authority (DLSA) se aapko free lawyer mil sakta hai, POCSO cases mein yeh specially important hai, Section 40 bhi legal aid ka support bolta hai. District court mein DLSA ka office hota hai, wahaan application de sakte hain. Childline 1098 ya women helpline se bhi DLSA ka contact le sakte hain. Woh aapko lawyer, counselling aur support services arrange karenge.

Aapko pehle yeh dekhna hoga ki abhi [Victim] us [Relative] ke saath akela na rahe. Aap Childline 1098 par call kar sakte ho, ya local police / women cell se contact kar sakte ho. Main aapko step‑by‑step guide karunga.

Main khud 17 saal ka hoon, parents meri baat bhi nahi sunte. Woh kehte hain family matter hai, bahar mat leke jao. Par mujhe lagta hai [Relative] aur bhi bachchon ke saath kar sakta hai. Aapki age 17 hone ke baad bhi, aap complaint kar sakte ho. Law aapko rokta nahi. POCSO Act me reporting ko encourage kiya gaya hai, especially Section 19 me adults ke liye mandatory reporting hai, par minor bhi FIR register karwa sakta hai. Police ko bata sakte ho ki aap witness ho. Aapko offence nahi mana jayega; aap complainant / witness hoge. Agar direct police se dar lagta hai, pehle Childline 1098 ya kisi trusted NGO se baat kar sakte ho.

Agar main police ke paas jaun to process kya hoga? Kya [Victim] ko baar baar sab ke saamne batana padega kya hua? Woh already bahut ro raha hai, bolta hai main kisi ko nahi batana chahta. Kya police ya court me usko torture jaisa lagega? Mujhe ye bhi dar hai ki uski school me log jaan jayenge.

POCSO ke under bachche ka statement child‑friendly tareeke se lena zaroori hai. Police ideally ghar ya safe jagah par plain clothes me statement legi. Baad me Magistrate ke saamne statement record ho sakta hai, par Section 24 ke hisaab se intimidation ya repeated questioning avoid karna chahiye. Court me bhi in‑camera proceedings hoti hain, public ko allow nahi karte. Child Welfare Committee / counsellor bhi help kar sakte hain, taaki [Victim] ko kam se kam baar incident batana pade.

Mujhe samajhna hai ki law ke hisaab se ye exactly kya mana jata hai. Family bol rahi hai ‘sirf thoda chhed chhad thi, itna bada issue mat banao’. Lekin [Victim] bolta hai touch bohot galat tha. Kya sirf touching bhi sexual crime hai? Ye kaunse law ke andar aata hai?

Sirf ‘thoda chhed chhad’ bolne se offence kam nahi ho jata. 18 se kam bachche ke body parts ko sexual intention se touch karna POCSO Section 7 ke under ‘sexual assault’ hai. Agar koi penetration jaisa act hua ho to POCSO Section 3 (penetrative sexual assault) lag sakta hai; relative hone par Section 5/6 se punishment aur zyada hoti hai. Saath hi IPC Section 354, 354A, aur serious cases me 376 bhi apply ho sakta hai.

Punishment incident par depend karegi: POCSO Section 7/8 me usually 3 se 5 saal tak, Section 3/4 me 10 saal se life tak, aggravated (relative) me aur zyada. Exact term court decide karta hai. Dhamki dena bhi offence hai. Aap police se protection ki request kar sakte ho, bail conditions me contact ban karne ko bola ja sakta hai. Zarurat pade to Child Welfare Committee aur Juvenile Justice Act ke under shelter home / protection arrange ho sakta hai.

Mujhe abhi turant kya karna chahiye? Kya main school ke counsellor ya teacher ko bata sakta hoon? Par dar hai ki woh parents ko turant call kar denge. Sabse safe pehla step kya hoga aaj ke liye, jisse [Victim] bhi zyada na dare?

Agar aapke school me trustworthy teacher / counsellor ho jo sensitive ho, unko batana helpful ho sakta hai; woh bhi POCSO Section 19 ke under report karne ke zimmedar hote hain. Par agar lagta hai parents react bahut negative karenge, to pehla step Childline 1098 par confidential call ho sakta hai. Aap apna naam na batakar bhi guidance le sakte ho.
